Play Field Draw Beat Lines¶

class reamber.algorithms.analysis.playField.parts.PFDrawBeatLines.PFDrawBeatLines(divisions: Optional[List] = None, defaultColor: str = '#666666', divisionColors: Optional[Dict] = None)¶

Bases: reamber.algorithms.analysis.playField.parts.PFDrawable.PFDrawable

__init__(divisions: Optional[List] = None, defaultColor: str = '#666666', divisionColors: Optional[Dict] = None)¶

Draws beat lines by division specified

Supported Default Snap Colors: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 32.

The colors can be found in RAConst.

You can specify non-default snaps (including floats) and your custom divisionColors.

The new colors will override the default colors if they overlap.

Parameters

  • divisions – Defaults to [1, 2, 4], will draw 1/1, 1/2, 1/4 lines in the field

  • defaultColor – Default color to use when the snap color is not supported.

  • divisionColors – A custom color dictionary to use. This can be specified if you want to override colors. A template can be found in RAConst.DIVISION_COLOR.

draw(pf: PlayField) → PlayField¶

Refer to __init__
